title: Fixes for CVE-2019-18960
body:
We want to be able to:

- Check that when adding an offset to a base guest address, we stay within a single region
- Check that a guest range stays within a single region before resolving to a host address

See https://github.com/firecracker-microvm/firecracker/commit/2c3e3728f51527a95c770df2413e82abbc206bbb

title: Rename ByteValued and improve unit tests
body:
ByteValued doesn't seem suggestive enough to me. Would you agree with renaming it ? I think PlainData may be better. Otherwise I can drop the first commit and keep only the unit tests improvements.

- Rename ByteValued to PlainData
- improve associated unit tests

title: Implemented Binary search to gain O(log n) lookup performance in find_region()
body:
I have implemented Binary search in find_region which mentioned in #41 issue. There is UnsortedMemoryRegions mechanism to make sure sorting of memory regions during creating a new `GuestMemoryMmap` vector. That's why I just implemented binary search through sorted region map.

Signed-off-by: drmint80@gmail.com

title: [GuestMemoryMmap] polish from_regions() method
body:
- polish `from_regions()` method
- add more unit tests for `GuestMemoryMmap` constructors

title: [Address] small improvements to the unit tests
body:
- move `Address` related unit tests to `address.rs`
- refactor and add more unit tests for `add` and `sub` operations
- add unit tests for `Address::new`, `BitAnd`, `BitOr`, `Default`

title: [Address] add unchecked_offset_from() example
body: Add an example for the unchecked_offset_from method inside the Address trait

title: Introduce trait GetHostAddress
body:
Previously the get_host_address() implenents the way to map guest physical address to host virtual
address, but it's implemented as a method of the GuestMemoryMmap struct. There's no formal way
for clients to state the dependency on the capability to map GPA to HVA. So introduce trait
GetHostAddress to describe the capability to map GPA to HVA, so clients may depend on it.

Signed-off-by: Liu Jiang <gerry@linux.alibaba.com>

title: mmap: Allow an existing GuestMemoryMmap to be extended
body:
The public API of vm-memory is pretty limited regarding the actions
that can be performed on a GuestMemoryMmap. The only allowed action
is to create a new instance of a GuestMemoryMmap based on a list of
memory ranges, but there are use cases where we need to extend an
existing instance by appending more memory regions to the existing
ones.

This PR creates a new public function that can be used from any
caller in order to add new memory ranges to an existing guest memory.
Note that rework of the existing code was necessary to apply proper
factorization.

Signed-off-by: Sebastien Boeuf <sebastien.boeuf@intel.com>

title: mmap: Add a type parameter to the memory mapped regions
body:
In order to let the caller identify regions based on the region type,
this patch introduces a new parameter as part of the region creation.

Fixes #34

Signed-off-by: Sebastien Boeuf <sebastien.boeuf@intel.com>

title: switch to rust-vmm-ci
body:
Removed the existing buildkite pipeline and added the rust-vmm-ci
submodule as this is the agreed upon way of testing all crates in
rust-vmm.

Fixes: #36

title: [windows] Fix MmapRegion drop
body:
At the moment, we're not properly deallocating memory mapped regions.
The "VirtualFree" function will fail if the region size is specified
when using the "MEM_RELEASE" flag.

This change fixes it, also printing a message when VirtualFree fails,
which may help discovering memory leaks more easily.

Closes: #38

title: std Error impl for MmapError and volatile_memory Error
body: closes #18 and #17

title: [DNM] Fix windows for PR #29
migrate to rust edition 2018
body:
Migrate to rust edition 2018 so we could make use new features.

Signed-off-by: Liu Jiang <gerry@linux.alibaba.com>

title: guest_memory: Fix region access violation
body:
While call try_access from read_from, in try_access, it does not
check if start + len will cross over the end of the current region.
If it will, once pass the region to the closure, where the region
be converted to slice, and data is picked up there, from the start
to the end = start + len, then, region access violation will happen,
since start + len is out of range of the slice.

Get the len in a differen way in try_access to ensure it will not
cross over the region to avoid such error.

Signed-off-by: Cathy Zhang <cathy.zhang@intel.com>

title: Another iteration of supporting file backed memory regions
body:
This PR is based on code from Sebastien's original proposal (#20) and the subsequent comments and conversations.

As per Paolo's suggestion, the offset is now represented as an `u64`. I didn't name the new struct `FileRange`, because it should've also kept a `length` field, and that information is already available via the `len()` method of the `GuestMemoryRegion`. Instead I've called it `FileOffset` (will rename on demand), and it only keeps the `Arc<File>` and `offset`.

The Linux code is clearly ahead of the Windows one right now, and some harmonization is in order. I've just created a Windows VM on my machine, but didn't get the chance to install Rust and test things yet. It would be good to know if ppl are ok with the proposed way of implementing this functionality on Linux, and then we can bring the Windows implementation up to date as well (and add some more tests to this PR).

title: updated readme and design doc
body:
Mostly making sure that the markdown linter is happy.

Also rewrote a few phrases and rephrased the objectives of the crate.

title: Normalize license statements
body:
Normalize license statements as:
. BSD-3-Clause: code dirived from crosvm without modifications
. Apache2 or BSD-3-Clause: code dirived from crosvm with modifications
  and enhancements.
. Apache2: newly developed code

Signed-off-by: Liu Jiang <gerry@linux.alibaba.com>

Fix #13

title: Add CODEOWNERS file to auto-assign code reviewers
body: Fix #15

title: Switch CI to rustvmm/dev:v2 docker container
body: $SUBJECT says it all...

title: Add buildkite pipelines
body:
At the moment, we're using Travis for vm-memory tests and buildkite
for other crates.

This change adds a few buildkite pipeline definitions, which can
later on be moved to a common CI repository.

There are currently 4 pipelines, basically a matrix based on the
agent OS (Linux and Windows) and the feature list (default and
backend-mmap).

We're using the same workflow as the other CIs, going with the
Docker buildkite plugin and pointing to docker images that provide
Rust build tools.

title: Facilitate the creation of file backed guest memory regions
body:
In order to support use cases where the memory needs to be backed by
actual files in order to be shared across processes (vhost-user case),
this patch introduces a new function creating the guest memory with
each region backed by a file descriptor provided by the caller.

It also introduces two helpers to retrieve file information related
to a region. Each file is owned by the memory region so that the
caller does not have to deal with ownership. This way, the file gets
to live as long as the memory region is active.

Signed-off-by: Sebastien Boeuf <sebastien.boeuf@intel.com>

title: volatile_memory: add VolatileArrayRef and &std::sync::atomic::Atomic* accessors
body:
Allow easily access to an array stored in a VolatileMemory object, removing
the need to do multiplications and pointer offsetting.

title: Typos in DESIGN.md
mmap: Export MmapError
body:
mmap callers need this to properly propagate the memory model errors.

Fixes: #11

Signed-off-by: Samuel Ortiz <sameo@linux.intel.com>

title: Port the mmap backend to windows
body:
This pull request implements the Windows version of the mmap-backend.

It is an initial version that probably contains some issues wrt to comments and formatting and there are still failing tests, but the main functionality works fine.

I suggest as an additional change to rename the *_raw_fd functions to _raw_file and add a RawFile trait on top of RawFd for unix and RawHandle for Windows. Please let me know what you think about this.

title: Add GuestMemory method to return an Iterator
body: Fix #8

title: Add more methods
body: I have noticed some missing methods while trying to port Firecracker to rust-vmm/vm-memory. This pull request adds them.

body:
I've already got a region of mmap's from files and want a memory map.
(In this case from set_mem_table in a vhost-user)

title: Initial implementation of the vm-memory crate v3
body:
Hi all,
       Thank you all for reviewing the previous PR at https://github.com/rust-vmm/vm-memory/pull/1 . With patches to address the review comments, the commit history became a little messy. So I clean up the patch series by folding those trivial patches into other commits, the result patch set becomes much more cleaner. And a new PR is created to ease reviewing and merging.  I will close the other PR once this one gets merged.

Please refer to following links for related discussions:
https://github.com/rust-vmm/vm-memory/pull/1 
rust-vmm/community#22
rust-vmm/community#16
